Hello there!

CSIDH, the Commutative SIDH protocol

In 2018, Castryck, Lange, Martindale, Panny, and Renes proposed the CSIDH protocol [1], which can be viewed as a reinterpretation of Couveignes [3] and Rostovtsev-Stolbunov [2, 1] schemes but this time using supersingular curves defined over a prime field.

The most demanding computational task of CSIDH is evaluating its class group action, whose cost is dominated by performing a number of degree-â„“ isogeny constructions/evaluations 1.

Let E / Fp : By2 = x3 + Ax2 + x be a supersingular elliptic curve with (p + 1) rational points, and m âˆŠ Z. Then, CSIDH can be summarized as follows:

graph TD
    START(Start) -- "To process the i-th entry" --> IF1{"Has m<sub>i</sub> degree-â„“<sub>i</sub><br/>isogeny constructions<br/>been permformed?"};
    subgraph " "
    IF1 -- No --> IF2{"e<sub>i</sub> == 0?"};
    IF2 -- Yes --> WD[/"To perform a<br/>dummy-isogeny<br/>construction"/];
    IF2 -- No --> DF[/"To perform a<br/>degree-â„“ isogeny<br/>evaluation"/];
    DF --> DEC["e<sub>i</sub> -= 1"];
    WD --> FIN{"Are there missing<br/>isogeny constructions?"}
    DEC -->FIN;
    FIN -- Yes --> IF1;
    end
    FIN -- No --> END(End);
